column1:
0916|9:16 A.M.|Thursday 9:16 A.M.
Yuri Androv stood at the far end of the flood-lit hangar
column2: staring up at the underbelly of Daedalus I and thinking. This morning's run-up in the centrifuge had gone well. At last he was convinced there was no physiological barrier to hypersonic flight
column3: at least none he couldn't handle.
